quote: ''In giving our citizens a sense of ownership of information, we hope it leads to a realization both on the part of citizens and of government (that access to information) goes beyond privilege. It serves as a reminder to everyone, lest some people in government forget, that sovereignty resides in the people and that public office is a public trust.''
''Examine (dynasties) qualitatively and quantitatively where (they) serve public interest... But if you will make me decide now, no to dynasties.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''Yes, but threshold should be taken into consideration... Let's not use taxes to accelerate debt.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''It's important that we stay the course on the passage of the Bangsamoro Basic Law... We cannot inflict [a halt to] the peace process. The long-term cost might be too high to bear.''

''Fight but with diplomacy, joint exploration and use. And then peaceful legal means. But go for multilateral more than bilateral at the same time, inventory our multi-lateral... security and economic arrangements so that we will determine if they still serve their purpose.'' <b>- Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

''Dapat comprehensive na. Ang sinasabi lang naman ay hindi naman desisyunan na. Simulan na ang talakayan. Let's have an informed national debate on the need for Charter Change na talaga namang kinakailangan.''
''It's a moral issue. It's a church, society, threshold issue. It's beyond my competence.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

QUALIFIED YES
''Yes, as long as we have an exit program... Once we throw them the salbabida, and get them to shore, what do we do with the funds available? Apply it to clear programs.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''It's exploitation in its highest form.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''It's something for the church and society to decide.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

''Yes after due process, but not Libingan ng mga Bayani yet because the recommendation of the Vice President is bury in the north with full military honors. That would set in motion the burial of this culture of anger, hatred and vindictiveness.''  <b>-InterAksyon interview with Gringo Honasan on October 21, 2015

''Present laws and policies are found to be inconsistent and inadequate to address cross-cutting land use issues because these are sector-specific and fragmented in approach... The conflict in the interpretation and scope of these laws have resulted in the overlapping of functions... conflicting claims, and competing uses of our finite resources.''
''Proceed, applying due process not converting it into partisan political issue.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

''No. Give them a compelling reason to come home but give them opportunities at home with clear policies and a clear national sense of priorities. Take care of them, especially the children who are left behind. Make them healthier, smarter, safer, happier.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''Yes, applying due process of law in court not in trial by publicity, being propagated by irresponsible, corrupt elements in the media.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''That is something for the church and society to decide. It is a threshold issue. I am not competent to decide that.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

QUALIFIED YES
''K to 12 is good but integrate backwards and go for nutrition. In every aspect of the collateral environment related to that issue. So, mother, father, community, barangay, province, region, nation.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015

''Continue agrarian reform... We do not only redistribute the land, but distribute the means of production, benefitting our most depressed sector, (the) agricultural (workers) and farmers.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''Yes. Peace at all costs.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''For humanitarian reasons so that we can show the world how we treat former Presidents if it is warranted by court proceedings, by due process.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
''Face corruption squarely. After due process, applying the rule of law, avoiding trial by publicity, which renders the court irrelevant.'' - Interview with InterAksyon, Oct. 21, 2015
